chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L. Running III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for Good Time Credit. Time Served Sentence.

Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Fine/Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the Fine/Costs
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

records.addlTxt: Cases 21CM256, 22CF113, & 22TR1164 called @ 11:24 AM Defendant Richard L. Running III in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Richard L. Running III. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 22CF113: Counts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Counts 3 & 4 - DRI. 22TR1164 - DRI. 21CM256: Both parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications by either party. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. The parties stipulate to 114 days CFTS. No argument by either party. Court orders: 152 days WC Jail, eligible for GT. 114 days CFTS. Time served sentence. 22CF113: Court orders: As to Count 1 only: S/W - 2 years probation. Conditions: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. As to Count 2 only: 100 days WC Jail, eligible for GT Credit, 75 days CFTS. Time served sentence. 12 month rev/IID. OWI assessment. $42.50 blood draw fee w/ 60 DTP or PP. $350 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal rights given.
